logTitle: IELTS Reading Log: Why we need to protect polar bears

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Polar bears are being increasingly threatened by the effects of climate change...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Bị 'đe dọa' (threatened) 'ngày càng tăng' (increasingly)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To be more and more at risk of harm or danger

phase3Production.content: Many species are increasingly threatened by habitat loss.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...but their disappearance could have far-reaching consequences.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Những 'hậu quả' (consequences) 'có ảnh hưởng sâu rộng' (far-reaching)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Effects that are extensive and have a wide influence or impact

phase3Production.content: The invention of the internet has had far-reaching consequences for society.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: They are uniquely adapted to the extreme conditions of the Arctic Circle...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: 'Thích nghi một cách độc đáo' (uniquely adapted) 'với' (to) các điều kiện khắc nghiệt

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To be specially suited in a way that is unlike anything else for a particular environment or situation
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Thích nghi một cách độc đáo với

phase3Production.content: Camels are uniquely adapted to life in the desert.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Humans with comparative levels of adipose tissue would be considered obese...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: 'Mô' (tissue) 'mỡ' (adipose)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A technical term for body fat

phase3Production.content: Adipose tissue is important for storing energy and insulating the body.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...would be considered obese and would be likely to suffer from diabetes...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Sẽ 'được coi là' (be considered) 'béo phì' (obese)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To be regarded as grossly fat or overweight

phase3Production.content: A person with a BMI over 30 is generally considered obese.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: A 2014 study by Shi Ping Liu and colleagues sheds light on this mystery.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: 'Làm sáng tỏ' (sheds light on) 'bí ẩn' (mystery) 'này' (this)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To help explain or provide new information about something that is difficult to understand
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Làm sáng tỏ bí ẩn này

phase3Production.content: The new research sheds light on the causes of the disease.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: They compared the genetic structure of polar bears with that of their closest relatives...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: 'Cấu trúc' (structure) 'di truyền' (genetic)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: The arrangement and composition of genes in an organism

phase3Production.content: Scientists are studying the genetic structure of the virus to develop a vaccine.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: In humans, mutations of this gene are associated with increased risk of heart disease.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Các 'đột biến' (mutations) 'của' (of) 'gen' (gene) 'này' (this)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Changes in the genetic sequence of a gene
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Các đột biến của gen này

phase3Production.content: Certain mutations of the BRCA1 gene can increase the risk of breast cancer.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...are associated with increased risk of heart disease.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: 'Nguy cơ' (risk) 'bị bệnh tim' (of heart disease) 'tăng cao' (increased)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A higher probability of developing heart-related medical problems
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Nguy cơ mắc bệnh tim tăng cao

phase3Production.content: Smoking is associated with an increased risk of heart disease.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...affects our older generation: osteoporosis.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Bệnh 'loãng xương' (osteoporosis)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A medical condition in which the bones become brittle and fragile from loss of tissue

phase3Production.content: A diet rich in calcium can help prevent osteoporosis in later life.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...usually caused by insufficient exercise, reduced calcium intake or food starvation.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: 'Tập thể dục' (exercise) 'không đủ' (insufficient)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Not enough physical activity

phase3Production.content: A sedentary lifestyle with insufficient exercise can lead to health problems.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...reduced calcium intake or food starvation.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Lượng 'canxi' (calcium) 'hấp thụ' (intake) 'bị giảm' (reduced)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A lower than recommended consumption of calcium

phase3Production.content: Reduced calcium intake during childhood can affect bone development.

lexicalItems.targetLexeme: Bone tissue is constantly being remodelled
lexicalItems.sourceContext: Bone tissue is constantly being remodelled, meaning that bone is added or removed...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: 'Mô xương' (Bone tissue) 'liên tục' (constantly) 'được' (is being) 'tái tạo' (remodelled)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: The living tissue of bones is continuously being broken down and rebuilt
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Mô xương liên tục được tái tạo

phase3Production.content: Throughout our lives, our bone tissue is constantly being remodelled to adapt to stress.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...depending on nutrient availability and the stress that the bone is under.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: 'Sự sẵn có' (availability) 'của chất dinh dưỡng' (nutrient)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: The extent to which nutrients are present and accessible for use by an organism
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Sự sẵn có của chất dinh dưỡng

phase3Production.content: Plant growth is limited by nutrient availability in the soil.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Female polar bears, however, undergo extreme conditions during every pregnancy.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: 'Trải qua' (undergo) 'những điều kiện' (conditions) 'khắc nghiệt' (extreme)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To experience or be subjected to very difficult or severe circumstances
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Trải qua những điều kiện khắc nghiệt

phase3Production.content: The explorers had to undergo extreme conditions during their Antarctic expedition.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...these females will dig maternity dens in the snow...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Đào 'hang' (dens) 'để sinh sản' (maternity)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Shelters, usually dug in snow or earth, where a female animal gives birth and raises her young

phase3Production.content: The polar bear cubs will stay in the maternity den for the first few months of their lives.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: This process results in about six months of fasting...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Khoảng sáu 'tháng' (months) 'nhịn ăn' (of fasting)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A period of many months of abstaining from all or some kinds of food or drink

phase3Production.content: Some animals endure long months of fasting during hibernation.

lexicalItems.targetLexeme: depleting their own calcium and calorie reserves
lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...depleting their own calcium and calorie reserves.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: 'Làm cạn kiệt' (depleting) 'lượng dự trữ' (reserves) 'canxi' (calcium) 'và' (and) 'calo' (calorie) 'của chính chúng' (their own)

phase2Annotation.phonetic: /dɪˈpliːtɪŋ ðeər əʊn ˈkælsiəm ənd ˈkæləri rɪˈzɜːvz/
phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Using up or exhausting one's own supply of calcium and energy
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Làm cạn kiệt dự trữ canxi và calo của chính mình

phase3Production.content: Intense exercise can end up depleting your body's energy reserves.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Despite this, their bones remain strong and dense.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Xương của chúng 'vẫn' (remain) 'chắc' (strong) 'và' (and) 'đặc' (dense)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To continue to be solid, thick, and not easily broken

phase3Production.content: It is important to eat well so your bones remain strong and dense.

lexicalItems.targetLexeme: found an explanation for this paradox
lexicalItems.sourceContext: Physiologists Alanda Lennox and Allen Goodship found an explanation for this paradox in 2008.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Đã 'tìm thấy một lời giải thích' (found an explanation) 'cho' (for) 'nghịch lý' (paradox) 'này' (this)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To discover the reason for a seemingly absurd or self-contradictory statement or proposition
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Tìm ra lời giải thích cho nghịch lý này

phase3Production.content: The scientist finally found an explanation for this strange paradox.

lexicalItems.targetLexeme: increase the density of their bones
lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...pregnant bears were able to increase the density of their bones before they started to build their dens.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Có thể 'tăng' (increase) 'mật độ' (the density) 'xương' (of their bones)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To make the bones more compact and solid

phase3Production.content: Weight-bearing exercise can help to increase the density of your bones.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...there was no evidence of significant loss of bone density.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Không có 'bằng chứng' (evidence) 'về' (of) 'sự mất mát' (loss) 'mật độ xương' (of bone density) 'đáng kể' (significant)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A substantial or noteworthy decrease in the compactness of bone tissue
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Sự mất mật độ xương đáng kể

phase3Production.content: After the age of 30, many people begin to experience a gradual but significant loss of bone density.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Hibernating brown bears do not have this capacity and must therefore resort to major bone reformation in the following spring.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Phải 'dùng đến/nhờ đến' (resort to) 'việc tái tạo xương' (bone reformation) 'lớn' (major)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To have to use or do something (like large-scale bone rebuilding) because there is no other choice
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Phải dùng đến việc tái tạo xương quy mô lớn

phase3Production.content: When negotiations failed, they had to resort to legal action.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...many bedridden humans, and even astronauts, could potentially benefit.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Nhiều 'người' (humans) 'nằm liệt giường' (bedridden)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: People who are confined to bed because of illness or injury

phase3Production.content: The treatment could help prevent muscle loss in bedridden patients.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...these should not be the only factors taken into consideration.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Những yếu tố duy nhất 'được xem xét/cân nhắc' (taken into consideration)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To be thought about carefully when making a decision or judgment
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Được xem xét, được cân nhắc

phase3Production.content: All relevant facts must be taken into consideration before a verdict is reached.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...we think are intelligent and possess emotions, such as elephants and primates.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: 'Sở hữu' (possess) 'cảm xúc' (emotions)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To have or own feelings, such as happiness, sadness, or fear

phase3Production.content: Many people believe that animals like dogs and cats possess emotions.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Bears, on the other hand, seem to be perceived as stupid and in many cases violent.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Dường như 'bị cho là/bị nhìn nhận là' (be perceived as) 'ngu ngốc' (stupid)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To be regarded or understood in a particular way, in this case as being unintelligent
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Bị cho là/nhìn nhận là ngu ngốc

phase3Production.content: Sharks are often wrongly perceived as mindless killing machines.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: And yet anecdotal evidence from the field challenges those assumptions...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: 'Bằng chứng' (evidence) 'giai thoại/truyền miệng' (anecdotal)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Evidence in the form of personal stories or isolated examples, rather than systematic scientific data

phase3Production.content: While there is a lot of anecdotal evidence, there is no scientific proof that it works.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...anecdotal evidence from the field challenges those assumptions...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: 'Thách thức' (challenges) 'những giả định' (assumptions) 'đó' (those)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To question or dispute the truth or validity of those beliefs that are taken for granted
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Thách thức những giả định đó

phase3Production.content: The new data challenges the long-held assumptions about the planet's atmosphere.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...suggesting for example that polar bears have good problem-solving abilities.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: 'Khả năng' (abilities) 'giải quyết vấn đề' (problem-solving)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: The capacity to find solutions to difficult or complex issues
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Khả năng giải quyết vấn đề

phase3Production.content: Chess is a game that develops critical thinking and problem-solving abilities.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...observed making use of a tool to manipulate his environment.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: 'Điều khiển/thao túng' (manipulate) 'môi trường' (environment) 'của mình' (his)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To handle or control one's surroundings in a skillful manner
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Điều khiển/thao túng môi trường của mình

phase3Production.content: Humans are unique in their ability to manipulate their environment on a large scale.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...on multiple occasions to dislodge a piece of meat hung out of his reach.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Để 'làm bật ra/lấy ra' (dislodge) 'một miếng thịt' (a piece of meat)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To knock or force something out of its position
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Làm bật ra/lấy ra một miếng thịt

phase3Production.content: He used a stick to dislodge the apple stuck in the tree.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: A calculated move by a male bear involved running and jumping onto barrels...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Một 'hành động/nước đi' (move) 'có tính toán' (calculated)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: An action that is planned and considered in advance
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Một hành động có tính toán

phase3Production.content: His resignation was a calculated move to gain public sympathy.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...polar bears showed deliberate and focussed manipulation.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Sự 'điều khiển/thao tác' (manipulation) 'có chủ ý' (deliberate) 'và' (and) 'tập trung' (focussed)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Skillful handling or control that is intentional and concentrated
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Sự điều khiển có chủ ý và tập trung

phase3Production.content: Playing the piano requires deliberate and focussed manipulation of the keys.

lexicalItems.targetLexeme: capable of agile and thought-out behaviours
lexicalItems.sourceContext: These examples suggest that bears are capable of agile and thought-out behaviours.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: 'Có khả năng' (capable of) 'có những hành vi' (behaviours) 'nhanh nhẹn' (agile) 'và' (and) 'có suy tính' (thought-out)

phase2Annotation.phonetic: /ˈkeɪpəbl əv ˈædʒaɪl ənd θɔːt aʊt bɪˈheɪvjəz/
phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Having the ability to perform actions that are quick, nimble, and well-planned
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Có khả năng có những hành vi nhanh nhẹn và có suy tính

phase3Production.content: Dolphins are capable of complex and thought-out behaviours.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...bears have greater creativity and problem-solving abilities than previously thought.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: 'Sự sáng tạo' (creativity) 'lớn hơn' (greater)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A higher level of imagination or original ideas

phase3Production.content: The new project allows for greater creativity and innovation.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...hitting out at ice and snow – seemingly out of frustration – when they have just missed out on a kill.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: 'Dường như' (seemingly) 'vì' (out of) 'sự bực bội/thất vọng' (frustration)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Appearing to be because of a feeling of annoyance or upset when unable to do something

phase3Production.content: He slammed the door, seemingly out of frustration with the bad news.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...when they have just missed out on a kill.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Khi chúng 'vừa mới' (have just) 'để vuột mất' (missed out on) 'một con mồi' (a kill)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To fail to catch or successfully hunt an animal for food
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Để vuột mất một con mồi

phase3Production.content: The lioness was exhausted after she missed out on a kill.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Moreover, polar bears can form unusual relationships with other species...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Có thể 'hình thành' (form) 'những mối quan hệ' (relationships) 'bất thường' (unusual)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To develop connections or bonds that are not common or expected
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Hình thành những mối quan hệ bất thường

phase3Production.content: The documentary showed how a cat and a bird can form an unusual relationship.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Remarkably, one hand-raised polar bear called Agee has formed a close relationship with her owner...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Một con 'gấu Bắc Cực' (polar bear) 'được nuôi bằng tay' (hand-raised)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A polar bear that has been cared for and fed by humans from a very young age, instead of by its mother
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Gấu Bắc Cực được nuôi bằng tay

phase3Production.content: The hand-raised lion cub was very comfortable around people.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...since polar bears are known to actively hunt humans in the wild.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Được biết là 'chủ động' (actively) 'săn' (hunt) 'người' (humans)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To deliberately and energetically pursue people in order to catch or kill them

phase3Production.content: Unlike most sharks, great whites are known to actively hunt humans on rare occasions.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...this would mean not only the loss of potential breakthroughs in human medicine...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Sự mất mát 'những đột phá' (breakthroughs) 'tiềm năng' (potential) 'trong' (in) 'y học' (medicine) 'của con người' (human)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Possible important new discoveries in the science or practice of the diagnosis, treatment, and prevention of disease
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Những đột phá tiềm năng trong y học nhân loại

phase3Production.content: Gene editing offers potential breakthroughs in the treatment of genetic disorders.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...the disappearance of an intelligent, majestic animal.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Sự biến mất của một 'loài động vật' (animal) 'thông minh' (intelligent), 'hùng vĩ' (majestic)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: An animal that is beautiful, powerful, or causing great admiration and respect

phase3Production.content: The lion is often called a majestic animal because of its impressive mane and powerful presence.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...their closest relatives from a warmer climate, the brown bears.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Họ hàng 'gần nhất' (closest) của chúng

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: The species that is most nearly related through a common ancestor

phase3Production.content: Chimpanzees are the closest relatives to humans in the animal kingdom.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...allowed polar bears to survive in one of the toughest environments on Earth.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Một trong những 'môi trường' (environments) 'khắc nghiệt nhất' (toughest)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: The most difficult or harsh places to live
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Những môi trường khắc nghiệt nhất

phase3Production.content: The desert is one of the toughest environments for survival.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Hibernating brown bears do not have this capacity...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Những con gấu nâu 'đang ngủ đông' (Hibernating)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Spending the winter in a dormant state

phase3Production.content: The hibernating bear will not eat or drink for several months.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...such as elephants and primates.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Như là voi và 'động vật linh trưởng' (primates)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A group of mammals that includes monkeys, apes, and humans

phase3Production.content: Gorillas, chimpanzees, and orangutans are all great apes, a type of primate.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...has even been observed on multiple occasions to dislodge a piece of meat...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Đã được quan sát 'nhiều lần' (on multiple occasions)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: On several different instances; many times

phase3Production.content: He has been late for work on multiple occasions this month.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...a piece of meat hung out of his reach.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Treo 'ngoài tầm với' (out of his reach) của nó

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: In a position where one cannot get to or touch something
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Ngoài tầm với của anh ấy/nó

phase3Production.content: He put the cookies on the top shelf, out of the children's reach.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...involved running and jumping onto barrels in an attempt to get to a photographer...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: 'Nhảy lên' (jumping onto) 'các thùng phuy' (barrels)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To leap on top of large, cylindrical containers

phase3Production.content: The dog was trained to jump onto barrels as part of an agility course.

lexicalItems.targetLexeme: in what appeared to be a game
lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...knocking them over in what appeared to be a game.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Trong một hành động 'dường như là' (in what appeared to be) 'một trò chơi' (a game)

phase2Annotation.phonetic: /ɪn wɒt əˈpɪəd tə biː ə ɡeɪm/
phase2Annotation.definitionEN: In a way that looked like it was a form of play or amusement
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Trong một hành động dường như là một trò chơi

phase3Production.content: The dolphins were leaping out of the water in what appeared to be a game.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...including playing with the dogs used to pull sleds in the Arctic.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: 'Chơi với' (playing with) 'những con chó' (the dogs)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To engage in activity for enjoyment and recreation with dogs

phase3Production.content: The children spent the afternoon playing with the dogs in the park.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...dogs used to pull sleds in the Arctic.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Những con chó 'dùng để' (used to) 'kéo' (pull) 'xe trượt tuyết' (sleds)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To draw or haul a vehicle on runners for conveying loads over snow or ice

phase3Production.content: Huskies are strong dogs that are often trained to pull sleds.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...Agee has formed a close relationship with her owner Mark Dumas...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Đã 'hình thành một mối quan hệ' (formed a relationship) 'thân thiết' (close)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To develop a strong bond or connection with someone
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Hình thành một mối quan hệ thân thiết

phase3Production.content: Over the years, she formed a close relationship with her mentor.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...a close relationship with her owner Mark Dumas to the point where they even swim together.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Thân thiết 'đến mức' (to the point where) 'họ' (they) 'thậm chí' (even) 'bơi' (swim) 'cùng nhau' (together)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To a degree or extent that something (often surprising) happens

phase3Production.content: He was exhausted to the point where he could barely stand.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: This is even more astonishing since polar bears are known to actively hunt humans in the wild.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Điều này 'thậm chí còn' (even more) 'đáng kinh ngạc hơn' (astonishing)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Even more surprising or impressive
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Thậm chí còn đáng kinh ngạc hơn

phase3Production.content: He won the race, but what was even more astonishing was his record-breaking time.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: If climate change were to lead to their extinction...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Nếu biến đổi khí hậu 'dẫn đến' (lead to) 'sự tuyệt chủng' (their extinction) 'của chúng' (their)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To cause a species to die out completely
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Dẫn đến sự tuyệt chủng của chúng

phase3Production.content: Overhunting can lead to the extinction of a species.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...this would mean not only the loss of potential breakthroughs in human medicine...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Sự 'mất mát' (loss) 'của' (of) 'những đột phá' (breakthroughs) 'tiềm năng' (potential)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: The disappearance of possible important new discoveries
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Sự mất mát những đột phá tiềm năng

phase3Production.content: The destruction of the rainforest represents a huge loss of potential breakthroughs in medicine.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...but more importantly, the disappearance of an intelligent, majestic animal.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Nhưng 'quan trọng hơn' (more importantly)..

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Used to introduce a point that is more significant than what has just been said

phase3Production.content: The plan will save us money, but more importantly, it will reduce our environmental impact.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...the extreme conditions of the Arctic Circle...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Vòng Bắc Cực

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: The imaginary line on the Earth's surface at a latitude of approximately 66.5° N, marking the southern limit of the Arctic region

phase3Production.content: The sun does not set for several weeks in summer inside the Arctic Circle.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...reduces levels of low-density lipoproteins (LDLs) – a form of ‘bad’ cholesterol.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Lipoprotein mật độ thấp (một loại cholesterol 'xấu')

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A type of lipoprotein that transports cholesterol in the blood, high levels of which are associated with an increased risk of heart disease

phase3Production.content: A healthy diet can help to lower your levels of low-density lipoproteins (LDLs).

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Physiologists Alanda Lennox and Allen Goodship found an explanation for this paradox...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Các nhà 'sinh lý học' (Physiologists)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Experts in physiology, the branch of biology that deals with the normal functions of living organisms and their parts

phase3Production.content: The physiologists studied how the athlete's body responded to extreme exercise.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...and even astronauts, could potentially benefit.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Và thậm chí cả 'phi hành gia' (astronauts)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A person who is trained to travel in a spacecraft

phase3Production.content: Astronauts experience bone density loss during long missions in space.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: The medical benefits of the polar bear for humanity certainly have their importance...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Những 'lợi ích' (benefits) 'về y học' (medical)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Advantages or positive effects related to the science of medicine

phase3Production.content: The study of this plant could have significant medical benefits.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...the polar bear for humanity certainly have their importance...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Cho 'nhân loại' (humanity)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: For the human race as a whole

phase3Production.content: This discovery is a great step forward for humanity.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: We tend to want to protect animals we think are intelligent...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Chúng ta 'có xu hướng' (tend to) 'muốn' (want to) bảo vệ động vật..

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To usually or be likely to have a desire to do something

phase3Production.content: People tend to want to help others in an emergency.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Bears, on the other hand, seem to be perceived as stupid...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Mặt khác, ngược lại

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Used to introduce a contrasting point or fact

phase3Production.content: I enjoy city life. On the other hand, I sometimes miss the peace of the countryside.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...observed making use of a tool to manipulate his environment.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Được quan sát 'sử dụng' (making use of) 'một công cụ' (a tool)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Using an object or device to achieve a purpose

phase3Production.content: Early humans started making use of tools made from stone.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Problem-solving ability has also been witnessed in wild polar bears, although not as obviously as with GoGo.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Mặc dù 'không rõ ràng bằng' (not as obviously as)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Not in a way that is as easy to see or understand as something else

phase3Production.content: He was upset, although not as obviously as his sister, who was crying.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...in an attempt to get to a photographer standing on a platform four metres high.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Trong 'một nỗ lực để' (in an attempt to) 'tiếp cận' (get to) một nhiếp ảnh gia

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: As an effort to reach or achieve something
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Trong một nỗ lực để đến/tiếp cận

phase3Production.content: He raised his voice in an attempt to be heard over the noise.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: For example, Ames observed bears putting objects in piles and then knocking them over...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: 'Đặt các đồ vật' (putting objects) 'thành đống' (in piles)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Arranging items one on top of another to form a heap or stack
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Xếp các đồ vật thành đống

phase3Production.content: The child spent hours putting blocks in piles and then knocking them down.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...putting objects in piles and then knocking them over...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Và sau đó 'làm đổ chúng' (knocking them over)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Causing something to fall to the ground

phase3Production.content: Be careful not to get too close to the table and knock over the vase.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...abilities than previously thought.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Hơn so với 'trước đây người ta nghĩ' (previously thought)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Than was believed or assumed in the past
phase2Annotation.translationVI: So với đã nghĩ trước đây

phase3Production.content: The universe is much larger than previously thought.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...many bears have been seen to hit out at ice and snow...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Được nhìn thấy 'đánh/đập' (hit out at) vào băng và tuyết

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To strike something with force, often in anger or frustration

phase3Production.content: In his anger, he started hitting out at the wall.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...to the point where they even swim together.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Đến mức họ thậm chí còn 'bơi cùng nhau' (swim together)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To move through water at the same time and in company with each other

phase3Production.content: It's amazing to see the bear and its owner swim together in the pool.
